result.execSummary:
The defendant Trayveion K. Lester was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 5 days - TIME SERVED.
Costs rolled into sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trayveion K. Lester

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person along w/Atty Christopher Bub.  VRC.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 5 days KCJ.  Credit for 5 days served.  Costs rolled into sentence.  DNA sample previously provided.  Appeal rights.
Plea hearing on May 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.
plea hrg reset to 5/6 @ 10:15am due to ongoing jury trial
